the German perspective on the outcome of COP26 in Glasgow and what and what this means for us
This weekend we have all been following COP26, the most important conference concerning one of our biggest global issues: climate change!
World leaders have come together in order to find new ways and arrangements to fight climate change.
But what have they actually discussed and do different countries still have differing opinions on climate change?
From a German perspective, COP26 has been a great success.
We were finally able to lay the groundwork of our fight against climate change.
Only by working together with other nations, we can make a difference.
As I said COP26 has laid the groundwork of climate agreements and it has to be seen that way.
Some critical voices like to point out that climate change cannot be solved by holding one conference after another.
They said that the outcome of COP26 could have been stronger regulations in order to stop climate change.
But only through these conferences we were able to agree on certain aims concerning climate change, for example in Paris.
And now we can see it in Glasgow.
We are moving forward, step-by-step, into a future without coal-fired power stations.
Only through COP26 we have been able to increasingly put pressure on states like China and India which are responsible for most damage done to our environment by mining and using coal.
COP26 send a message to the world The era of coal is over!
So now we know why COP26 has been a success by why has it been a success for Germany in particular?
German representatives have attended the conference together with a representative from other EUEuropean Union member states to represent Europe as a unity.
And the EUEuropean Union has been the reason why the abolishion of coal has been put on the agenda of COP26.
Without the EUEuropean Union, the issue of coal would not have been discussed at all.
Without our courage and determination for a change of minds, this agreement would not have been made.

COP26 has been another step on our path to a greener future and that is why we can see it as a success.
